column5: Don't write these reports nearly as often as I used to, especially outside of the winter months. Got the Covid this week though and that coughed up enough time to get spewing stuff out. For any interested, here's a latest about gar fishing around home. Bit of a recap of this season along with some of my history and how it follows along with the OFAH records and other big fish caught over the years. It's good stuff full of big fish, you might like something different. Ottawa River Gar. For The Record. https://bunksoutdoorangle.com/ottawa...or-the-record/Thanks for reading.Bunk
Good write up Bunk. Hopefully your covid isn't severe and you get through it. Thanks for sharing
Interesting writeup. Did not know they go that big.

On the mend man! Just finished a 7 day work iso and ready to roll. Thanks dude!Quote: Originally Posted by valley366Interesting writeup. Did not know they go that big.Makes them something worth chasing up here during an fishing period when it's panfish, a few trout options, carp or them. The bass, walleye, pike and such season, are often still closed. Thanks for reading.
Gar a blast to catch and good to eat. Great fish that gets a bad rap.
